key_title: Key to the species of Casuarina

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Casuarinaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Casuarinaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Casuarinaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Ribs on branchlets angular; articles 6–9 mm long; leaf teeth 8–10 (see note following genus description)
Ribs on branchlets flat to rounded; articles 8–20 mm long; leaf teeth 9–16 or more
Teeth 9–13; branchlets more or less densely pubescent, ribs slightly wrinkled and either flat or with a yellowish median groove (often obscured by wax)
Teeth 12–16 (–20 on sucker branches); branchlets glabrous or sparsely pubescent, ribs smooth and either flat or slightly rounded
Teeth erect or slightly spreading on new permanent shoots; plants of occasionally inundated, sometimes brackish swampy areas in western Victoria
Teeth long-recurved on new permanent shoots; plants naturalised in Victoira, occurring near freshwater streams in the greater Melbourne region
